subtitle: hi welcome to meaningful Monday's where
we answer your personal questions the
question this week is betrayal by a
religious leader a religious leader I
trusted has betrayed me revealing
serious moral failings which have
seriously hurt my family he has asked
for my forgiveness and renewed trust and
respect I feel I cannot trust or respect
him again how can a man so learn it fall
so low and how are we supposed to make
sense of this one of the deepest forms
of betrayals is when so on who we expect
the trust sown in a position of a
spiritual religious leader betrays us
the wound of that often doesn't go away
an entire lifetime but yet we cannot be
a victim of circumstances what someone
else does to us should not impact the
rest of our lives or well or else we'll
being held hostage by that person in
their behavior but firstly you have to
establish whether perhaps his apology is
sincere skeptically and cautiously if it
is indeed so sehr it may be something to
explore and see if you can reconcile if
on the other hand you establish that
absolutely you cannot find a way to
trust him move on don't dwell on it find
other people that you can trust it may
take some time but all wounds can be
healed the worst is to dwell and to
obsess and to be consumed by it because
then the initial pain continues to be a
force in our lives and this is true in
every type of betrayal every type of
disappointment anything the way we've
been hurt some people just continue to
be broken continue to be angry bitter
and an effect it destroys their lives
you'll see healthy people learn the
resilience they feel the pain they
swallow it and then they move on and try
to build their lives in a constructive
fashion thank you for watching this has
been meaningful Monday's you can submit
your questions
by clicking on the link below everyone
have a very meaningful
